definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: He poured wine personally for the soldiers who returned from the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 他亲自为前线回来的将士斟酒。

sentences.english: What led these men and women to wear their country's uniform?
sentences.chinese: 是什么促使这些男女将士穿上这个国家的军装？

sentences.english: They sent it to the Australian War Memorial for analysis.
sentences.chinese: 他们把金属送到澳大利亚阵亡将士纪念馆做分析。

sentences.english: But it was great that we all rose above it and got out there and started playing again.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们全体将士都拼搏向上，并重新起航走出阴霾。

sentences.english: This year is one when the folks at HKEx can rightfully break out the champagne.
sentences.chinese: 今年是香港交易所众将士可以开香槟庆祝的一年。

sentences.english: Britain says 179 of its troops have died in Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 英国说，179名将士在伊拉克战争中殉职。

sentences.english: The government ritual buries died generals and the soldiers, comforts them family member.
sentences.chinese: 政府礼葬死亡将士，抚恤其家属。

sentences.english: That will affect people's confidence in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 从长远角度考虑，这将打击众将士的信心。

sentences.english: Ancient fair ruin and the cenotaph of officers and soldiers fall in battle etc.
sentences.chinese: 古市集，废墟及阵亡将士纪念碑等。

sentences.english: The queen replied that she would apply it to the edges of her soldiers' swords.
sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特回答说，她会用那磨刀石磨利将士剑锋。

sentences.english: The king ordered his officers to inquire about the way, but failed to get any answer.
sentences.chinese: 国君派将士去打探，但没有一个人能找到回去的道路。

sentences.english: Our guys are still…and gals are still making sacrifices there.
sentences.chinese: 我军男女将士仍在那里流血流汗。

sentences.english: Kutuzov's wish was to attack next day, and all the army shared this desire.
sentences.chinese: 库图佐夫想在次日发起攻击，全军将士也都这样想。

sentences.english: Armor was used by the soldiers to protect themselves in the cold weapon era.
sentences.chinese: 铠甲是冷兵器战争时代将士披挂在身上的防护装具。

sentences.english: The powerful invaders met the resistance of the patriotic generals and solders in the Northern Navy of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 实力雄厚的侵略者遇到了北洋海军将士的顽强抵抗。

definition: commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
(in former times) upper, middle and lower army/army of right, center and left/(in modern times) the three armed services: Army, Navy and Air Force
